data.description:
Fetal Heart VR is a self-teaching tool to learn geometry, anatomy, and function of Congenital Heart Diseases.

With the app, you can make a virtual ultrasound scan of normal and abnormal heart models and learn specific anatomical and geometrical features typical for Congenital Heart Diseases. The controller simulates the ultrasound probe - by moving it like an ultrasound probe you can obtain all recommended fetal cardiac views for prenatal examination

With the Fetal Heart VR, we hope to enable a more personal, affordable opportunity to learn how to perform ultrasound scans, available for all professionals involved in prenatal sonography.

This version includes a healthy fetal heart as well as 14 Congenital Heart Defects: tetralogy of Fallot (TOF), Transposition of the Great Arteries (dTGA, lTGA),  hypoplastic left heart syndrome (HLHS MS-AA, HLHS MAAA), Critical Aortic Stenosis (CritAS), Atrio-Ventricular Septal Defect (AVSD, uAVSD) Double Outlet Right Ventricle (DORV) and more.

changelog.change_log:
Fetal Heart VR version:2.0.4. 
------ 

This is an initial release of our Fetal Heart VR app prepared for Oculus Quest and Quest 2, and a major upgrade from the Oculus Go version. 

WHAT'S NEW: 
- In the Quest version you are able to completely reproduce all the movements done with the echo probe during the examination, 
- The design of the Quest platform allowed us to improve the interface significantly. 
- This version covers a completely new model of the Normal Heart, that includes much more anatomical detail of the Heart and nearby cardiovascular structures. 
- In this version, we start to introduce Quizzes - a way to challenge yourself with recognizing different Congenital Heart Defects. 
- Freeze and CINE options are now available 
- for Normal Heart, recommended views from ISUOG, AIUM, and ASE guidelines can be detected 
- you can turn on the natural movements of the fetus that occur during any echo examination. 

SUPPORT & QUESTIONS
Are you having problems? Do you have a suggestion for a new feature? Please, write to us: 
info@mwusoftware.com 

Have a great day! 
Piotr from MWU Software
